summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 25, 2019, discussing victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's upcoming arrest. The emails coordinate between FBI Victim Specialists in New York to compile and index victim information from the VNS (Victim Notification System) to ensure victims are notified of their rights promptly after the arrest.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case for which victim notification procedures are being coordinated. The emails reference an upcoming arrest.

events.title: FBI Coordination on Epstein Victim Notification
events.description: Internal FBI emails discuss procedures for compiling victim information and notifying victims of their rights in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's upcoming arrest.

events.title: Anticipation of Epstein Arrest
events.description: An FBI email states awareness of an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, with plans for SDNY to issue a press release and an 800 number for victims to self-identify.

keyFacts: The FBI was actively preparing victim notification procedures in anticipation of Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in June 2019.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) planned to issue a press release and an 800 number for victims to self-identify after the arrest.
FBI Victim Specialists were coordinating to compile victim information from the Victim Notification System (VNS), emphasizing the need for full names, addresses, and guardian information for minors.
The communication highlights the procedural steps taken to comply with federal victim notification laws in a high-profile case.
Multiple FBI personnel (names redacted) in New York were involved in the coordination, with one noting they were in Oklahoma for work until July 3.
